item.title: Dagster + Snowflake: Building Production AI Pipelines with Cortex
item.description: Snowflake handles AI compute while Dagster handles orchestration, observability, and the operational patterns that turn AI experiments into reliable production pipelines.

item.title: Your GTM Data, Finally Untangled
item.description: Compass now connects directly to your go-to-market tools, letting you ask questions about pipeline, ad spend, and sales conversations in Slack without exporting CSVs or waiting on the data team.

item.title: Dignified Python: 10 Rules to Improve your LLM Agents
item.description: Modern LLMs generate patterns, not principles. Dignified Python gives agents the intent they lack, ensuring code is explicit, consistent, and engineered with care. Here are ten rules from our Claude prompt.

item.title: Evaluating Model Behavior Through Chess
item.description: Benchmarks measure outcomes, not behavior. By letting AI models play chess in repeatable tournaments, we can observe how they handle risk, repetition, and long-term objectives, revealing patterns that static evals hide.

item.title: How to Enforce Data Quality at Every Stage: A Practical Guide to Catching Issues Before They Cost You
item.description: This post gives you a framework for enforcing data quality at every stage so you catch issues early, maintain trust, and build platforms that actually work in production.

item.description: This post introduces a custom async executor for Dagster that enables high-concurrency fan-out, async-native libraries, and incremental adoption, without changing how runs are launched or monitored.

item.title: How to Build a Data Platform That Actually Scales
item.description: Most teams build data platforms reactively when you should be architecting one that scales with your business, not against it.

item.title: Orchestrating Nanochat: Building the Tokenizer
item.description: Every great model starts with great data. This first part walks through how to structure ingestion with Dagster, prepare your text corpus, and build a tokenizer that shapes how your model understands the world.
